ygData.msgSnippet: OOC: How to say ... he grabs her, headbuts her, and by consequence wrenches the harpoon stuck in her gullet from the last round.  What s there to reword - I

OOC: How to say ... he grabs her, headbuts her, and by consequence 
wrenches the harpoon stuck in her gullet from the last round.  What's 
there to reword - I never made any mention of actual damage, there's 
three different dimensions the harpoon could turn in, and I was just 
pointing out that it was going crosswise as opposed to spinning in 
place.  In any event, it's the same attack, possibly the same end 
result.  Post your own interpretation of what happens to Dreadplague 
when Riekan goes berserk.

I don't mean to be rude, but I never gave any semblance of a damage 
report in my initial post.  Sorry if it was misinterpreted, but you 
never said anything to the effect that she wasn't speared, so I 
assumed the blade was there to pull on.  Same deal with Dread's sword 
in Riekan's arm - once the arm goes forward, it's not exactly easy to 
keep hold of the sword.

I'm rambling again. -_-

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> OOC: I won't accept Riekan damages since they were already dealt
> without my acceptation. Would it be possible to repost for him?
> 
> Bic:
> 
> Tyrael was hit fully by Noir, but he shook off the numbness and
> transformed to phoenix mode. One of Jayde' shot grazed behind his
> wing, so he pushed himself over and behind his pursuant. He threw 
four
> lightball at her.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > Fury is frozen by fear and knocked away, but Riekan's emotion 
chips 
> > were changed to match his organic side - a great white shark - 
and he 
> > has only two major moods; his normal, brooding self and a blind 
> > frenzy.  Things like fear and love are beyond him other than in 
small 
> > quantities.  His free arm comes up automatically to block the 
sword - 
> > which promptly becomes lodged in it.  Between that pain and the 
> > emotional overload, the shark-bot is driven into the Jaws-like 
> > behavior people would expect of his beast form.  With a roar, he 
> > latches onto Dreadplague's throat with an iron grip, fairly well 
> > wrenching the sword out of the femme's hands and exacerbating his 
own 
> > wound.  He headbutts his antagonist, twisting the harpoon lodged 
in 
> > her body so that it starts tearing through her internal systems.
> > 
> > Noir narrowly avoids the shards and retaliates with her 
blasters.  
> > Jayde proves to be an even harder target to pin down in vehicle 
mode 
> > than as a robot, and scoots under Tyreal as he jumps.  Coming 
back 
> > around, she squeezes off an ion shot from behind.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Dreadplague shrieks again of a cry scary enough to freeze even 
the
> > > most effective coolant. She intensifies her panic grip on both 
her
> > > assailants, which diminishes her influence on Jayde and Noir. 
> > However,
> > > Fury and Riekan would barely be able to move. It was fear she
> > > instilled, and that was the only universal unstoppable weapon.
> > > 
> > > She raised her sword and the close range allowed her to strike
> > > directly at his throat. Just after, she kicked at Fury.
> > > 
> > > Tyrael shot two light shards at Noir then jumped at Jayde, 
trying to
> > > plant his claws in her.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"

> > > > The Rogues pull up to avoid the brunt of the explosion, but 
it 
> > > > disrupts their cloaking devices (and singes a few armor 
plates) 
> > > > anyway.
> > > > 
> > > > Riekan is the nearest Rogue to Dreadplague, but he sees her 
> > coming 
> > > > and parries her sword with his shark-fin blade, letting her 
land 
> > on 
> > > > the muzzle of his harpoon gun.  "I don't have to," he hisses 
as 
> > he 
> > > > looses a dragline harpoon - it's too close for an explosive 
> > bolt.  
> > > > The gun packs quite a punch; at this range, it would be more 
than 
> > > > enough to send the spear-like projectile through any known 
armor 
> > > > plating, including technorganic-2's.
> > > > 
> > > > Fury dives in on the femme from behind, retracting his 
lashknife 
> > into 
> > > > a short sword and swiping at Dreadplague's back.
> > > > 
> > > > The two female Rogues (both in vehicle mode) go for Tyreal, 
Noir 
> > > > launching more of her missiles and Jayde firing ion bursts.
